sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 36 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C36, the alternating group A4 × C3, or one of the nine non-abelian groups of order 36.
message_1: What are the nine non-abelian groups of order 36, and for each of them, provide an explicit isomorphism to either the cyclic group C36 or the direct product of A4 (the alternating group of order 4) and C3?
message_2:
There are nine non-abelian groups of order 36, but not all of them are isomorphic to either C36 or A4 × C3. C36 is an abelian group, so none of the non-abelian groups can be isomorphic to it. The nine non-abelian groups of order 36 are:

1. S3 × C6
2. A4 × C3
3. (C3 × C3) ⋊ C4
4. (C6 × C3) ⋊ C2
5. (C9 × C2) ⋊ C2
6. C3 ⋊ C12
7. C6 ⋊ C6
8. C18 ⋊ C2
9. C9 ⋊ C4

Out of these nine groups, only A4 × C3 is isomorphic to the direct product of A4 and C3. The isomorphism is the identity map, as the group structure is already given as the direct product of A4 and C3:

ϕ: A4 × C3 → A4 × C3
ϕ((a, b)) = (a, b)

where a ∈ A4 and b ∈ C3. This is an isomorphism because it is a bijective homomorphism.
